newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil ends firm, off high, Brent rangebound.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil ends firm, off high, Brent rangebound.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures closed firmer, but off session highs, with the timing of Iraqi exports the main driver behind an otherwise cautious market, brokers said.
July gas oil closed $1.50 a tonne up at $165.25, having touched a high of $166. August Brent was trading mid-range at $18.35 a barrel at 1708 GMT, having failed to break through resistance at $18.45.
Iraqi envoy Abdul Amir al-Anbari said that he did not anticipate Baghdad resuming crude flows until August.
"It would take about a month for the new resolution to be implemented, including the oil sales," Anbari told Reuters in an interview in Geneva on Monday.
The market had foreseen an early to mid-July date after Iraqi oil minister Amir Muhammed Rasheed last week predicted quick agreement with the United Nations on an aid distribution plan.
IPE and NYMEX futures both firmed on Anbari's remarks, but gains were modest and trading volumes thin.
Brokers said that the upcoming long weekend in the United States for Independence Day was subduing activity.
"Maybe there's a lack of commitment to new positions bearing in mind the long holiday coming up...people don't want to be exposed for too long," said a broker.
